PCI-DSS-Req-1.1.title: Firewall Configuration Standards
PCI-DSS-Req-1.1.description: Firewall and router configuration standards do not meet PCI-DSS requirements. Missing formal approval process for network connections and firewall rule changes. Configuration review procedures are not documented.
PCI-DSS-Req-1.1.remediation: Document and implement comprehensive firewall configuration standards. Establish formal change management process with approval workflow. Create firewall rule review schedule. Implement automated configuration compliance monitoring.
PCI-DSS-Req-1.1.evidence: Firewall configuration review revealed missing change approval documentation. Files examined: /etc/firewall/rules.conf, /var/log/firewall-changes.log. Last review: Never. Recommendation: Implement Firewall Manager with integrated change control.

PCI-DSS-Req-1.2.title: Restrict Connections Between Untrusted Networks
PCI-DSS-Req-1.2.description: Insecure connections detected between cardholder data environment and untrusted networks. Firewall rules allow unrestricted traffic from untrusted sources.
PCI-DSS-Req-1.2.remediation: Configure firewalls to deny all traffic by default. Implement strict allow-list for necessary connections. Deploy DMZ architecture for internet-facing systems. Enable stateful packet inspection.
PCI-DSS-Req-1.2.evidence: Network traffic analysis identified unrestricted inbound connections from 0.0.0.0/0 on ports 22, 3389, 1433. Firewall rule audit log: /var/log/fw-audit/violations-2026-01.log. Detected at: 2026-01-09 14:23:15 UTC.

PCI-DSS-Req-2.1.title: Change Vendor-Supplied Defaults
PCI-DSS-Req-2.1.description: System deployed with vendor-supplied default credentials. Default accounts (admin, root) detected with factory passwords. Default SNMP community strings in use.
PCI-DSS-Req-2.1.remediation: Change all vendor-supplied defaults before production deployment. Remove or disable unnecessary default accounts. Implement automated scanning for default credentials. Document all system hardening procedures.
PCI-DSS-Req-2.1.evidence: Credential scan detected default credentials on 12 systems. Affected systems: db-server-01, app-server-05, switch-core-02. Evidence: /var/log/security/default-creds-scan.json. Scan timestamp: 2026-01-09 10:00:00 UTC.

PCI-DSS-Req-2.2.title: Configuration Standards for System Components
PCI-DSS-Req-2.2.description: System hardening standards not implemented. Unnecessary services and protocols enabled. Missing security configuration baseline documentation.
PCI-DSS-Req-2.2.remediation: Develop and implement system hardening standards based on industry best practices. Remove unnecessary services and protocols. Enable only required functionality. Document security configuration baseline.
PCI-DSS-Req-2.2.evidence: Configuration compliance scan failed. 47 unnecessary services detected. Full report: /var/log/security/hardening-scan-20260109.xml. Benchmark: CIS Level 1. Compliance score: 62/100.

PCI-DSS-Req-3.1.title: Data Retention and Disposal Policies
PCI-DSS-Req-3.1.description: Data retention policy not defined or enforced. Cardholder data stored beyond business justification period. No automated purging mechanism implemented.
PCI-DSS-Req-3.1.remediation: Establish and document data retention and disposal policy. Implement automated data purging mechanisms. Define business justification for all stored cardholder data. Deploy secure data destruction procedures.
PCI-DSS-Req-3.1.evidence: Database analysis revealed cardholder data older than 90 days. Records count: 15,847. Database: payment_archive. Query log: /var/log/db/retention-audit.log. Oldest record: 2024-03-15.

PCI-DSS-Req-3.4.title: Render PAN Unreadable

PCI-DSS-Req-3.4.remediation: Implement strong cryptography (AES-256) for PAN storage. Deploy tokenization or data masking where feasible. Establish key management procedures following industry standards. Encrypt sensitive authentication data.
PCI-DSS-Req-3.4.evidence: Database dump analysis found 3,245 records with unencrypted PAN. Tables: transactions, payment_methods. Evidence file: /var/log/security/pci-dss-req-3.4.log. Detection method: Regex pattern matching.

PCI-DSS-Req-4.1.remediation: Enforce TLS 1.2 or higher for all cardholder data transmissions. Disable weak ciphers and protocols. Implement certificate management procedures. Use only trusted encryption keys and certificates.
PCI-DSS-Req-4.1.evidence: TLS cipher suite analysis detected weak protocols. TLS 1.0/1.1 enabled on 8 servers. SSL Labs score: B. Scan report: /var/log/security/tls-scan-results.json. Weak ciphers: 3DES, RC4.

FEDRAMP-SC-7.description: FedRAMP boundary protection requirements not implemented. Network segmentation insufficient for federal data. Managed interfaces not clearly defined. DMZ architecture does not meet FedRAMP specifications. TIC 3.0 compliance not achieved.
FEDRAMP-SC-7.remediation: Implement FedRAMP-compliant boundary protection architecture. Deploy next-generation firewalls at all trust boundaries. Document all managed interfaces in system security plan. Achieve TIC 3.0 (Trusted Internet Connections) compliance. Implement network micro-segmentation for federal data separation.
FEDRAMP-SC-7.evidence: FedRAMP 3PAO assessment: Boundary protection inadequate. Network diagram review: /fedramp/network-architecture.pdf. TIC compliance: 34% complete. Managed interfaces: Not documented. Finding severity: High. Estimated remediation: 120 days.

FEDRAMP-SI-2.title: Flaw Remediation (FedRAMP Moderate)
FEDRAMP-SI-2.description: Vulnerability remediation does not meet FedRAMP timelines. Critical vulnerabilities not patched within 30 days. High severity vulnerabilities exceed 90-day remediation requirement. POA&M not maintained according to FedRAMP requirements.
FEDRAMP-SI-2.remediation: Establish FedRAMP-compliant patch management: Critical vulnerabilities within 30 days, High within 90 days. Implement automated vulnerability scanning per FedRAMP continuous monitoring. Maintain active POA&M with remediation milestones. Deploy compensating controls when patches unavailable. Report deviations to FedRAMP PMO.
FEDRAMP-SI-2.evidence: FedRAMP ConMon scan results: 15 critical vulnerabilities open >30 days. 34 high vulnerabilities open >90 days. POA&M status: 23 overdue items. Scan frequency: Monthly (compliant). Remediation SLA compliance: 56%. Report: /fedramp/conmon/vuln-summary-2026-01.pdf.

FEDRAMP-CA-2.title: Security Assessments (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-CA-2.description: Security assessments required by FedRAMP Rev 5 are overdue. 3PAO validation window missed and evidence packages are incomplete. Authorization package lacks recent assessment findings.
FEDRAMP-CA-2.remediation: Engage a FedRAMP-accredited 3PAO, update the security assessment plan, perform the required vulnerability scans, and package results in the SSP. Document remediation steps in the POA&M and submit the findings to the federal customer before the next authorization milestone.
FEDRAMP-CA-2.evidence: 3PAO report schedule: overdue by 28 days. Security assessment evidence incomplete: /fedramp/assessments/ca-2-pocket.json. Authorization package status: Assessment Step not completed. POA&M items related to CA-2: 4 open.

FEDRAMP-IR-4.title: Incident Response Testing (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-IR-4.description: FedRAMP incident response testing requirements not met. Quarterly playbooks not executed, tabletop exercises incomplete, and incident handling team has not verified notification timelines.
FEDRAMP-IR-4.remediation: Conduct FedRAMP-mandated incident response exercises, document lessons learned, update the IR playbook, and verify notification paths for federal stakeholders. Coordinate with the FedRAMP PMO on incident reporting timelines.
FEDRAMP-IR-4.evidence: IR test log: /fedramp/ir/ir-4-tests.log indicates last exercise performed 11 months ago. Incident communication drill: incomplete. Senior ops sign-off missing. Notification SLA sample: not validated.

FEDRAMP-MA-4.title: Nonlocal Maintenance (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-MA-4.description: Remote maintenance procedures do not align with FedRAMP requirements. Third-party vendors access production systems without dual authorization or break-glass controls.
FEDRAMP-MA-4.remediation: Implement dual control and break-glass processes for remote maintenance. Require tamper protection, split knowledge, and logging for vendor sessions. Review maintenance agreements and document CSP/customer responsibilities in the SSP.
FEDRAMP-MA-4.evidence: Remote maintenance audit: 19 sessions without dual review. Vendor MFA: not enforced. Maintenance plan: /fedramp/maintenance/ma-4-plan.pdf missing control references. Highest risk services: database, network.

FEDRAMP-CP-9.title: Information System Backup (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-CP-9.description: FedRAMP back-up requirements not satisfied; backups not encrypted at rest, and restoration procedures have never been exercised for federal customer data.
FEDRAMP-CP-9.remediation: Encrypt backups using FedRAMP-approved cryptography, document backup retention aligned with federal policy, and conduct restoration drills quarterly. Publish the results to the PMO and update the contingency plan.
FEDRAMP-CP-9.evidence: Backup audit: /fedramp/cp/cp-9-backup-report.xlsx shows unencrypted backups stored in plain text. Restoration drill: not conducted in 280 days. Backup retention policy: not approved.

FEDRAMP-PL-2.title: System Security Plan (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-PL-2.description: The SSP lacks required FedRAMP references and does not include privacy control mappings. Authority to Operate (ATO) milestones are missing from the plan.
FEDRAMP-PL-2.remediation: Update the SSP with FedRAMP Rev 5 references, include privacy control baselines, and map each control to implementation narratives. Align the plan with the authorization milestones and track statuses in the PMO portal.
FEDRAMP-PL-2.evidence: SSP snapshot: /fedramp/ssp/ssp-v1.pdf missing FedRAMP references. Privacy section: incomplete. ATO milestone schedule: undefined. Control ownership matrix: outdated.

FEDRAMP-RA-3.title: Risk Assessment (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-RA-3.description: FedRAMP risk assessments are not refreshed annually. Risk acceptance statements outdated, and threat models are not aligned with federal cloud risks.
FEDRAMP-RA-3.remediation: Update risk assessment documents annually, include federal threat intelligence, and publish risk acceptance decisions. Align the risk register with FedRAMP-specific threats from CISA and share outcomes with federal connectors.
FEDRAMP-RA-3.evidence: Risk register: /fedramp/ra/ra-3-register.xlsx last updated 14 months ago. Threat modeling: absent. Risk acceptance log: missing signatures.

FEDRAMP-SI-4.title: System Monitoring (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-SI-4.description: Continuous monitoring coverage does not meet FedRAMP high expectations. Alerts are not tuned for federal data, and automated anomaly detection is missing.
FEDRAMP-SI-4.remediation: Implement FedRAMP-approved monitoring rules, integrate with FedRAMP logging requirements, and enable anomaly detection for privileged activity. Publish monitoring metrics monthly to the PMO.
FEDRAMP-SI-4.evidence: Monitoring tuning log: /fedramp/si/si-4-tune.csv shows no federal data filters. Alerts fired: 2 per week with no responder. Anomaly detection: not enabled. ISSO notes: 'Insufficient coverage'.

FEDRAMP-AC-17.title: Remote Access (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-AC-17.description: Remote access for administrative users lacks FedRAMP protections. No jump-hosts, no strong authentication, and remote session monitoring is absent.
FEDRAMP-AC-17.remediation: Use FedRAMP-approved jump hosts, enforce multi-factor authentication with privileged elevation, and log remote sessions for federal accounts. Apply session masking for sensitive data transfers.
FEDRAMP-AC-17.evidence: Remote access audit: /fedramp/ac/ac-17-jumphost.json shows 12 sessions bypassing jump hosts. MFA: only password (not FedRAMP compliant). Monitoring: remote sessions not logged. FedRAMP ATO callout: 'Remote access missing'.

FEDRAMP-AC-19.title: Access Control for Mobile Devices (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-AC-19.description: FedRAMP mobile device controls incomplete. BYOD policies are not enforced, and mobile device management (MDM) lacks encryption profiling.
FEDRAMP-AC-19.remediation: Deploy FedRAMP-approved MDM solution, enforce device encryption, and register all mobile assets in the FedRAMP inventory. Enforce containerization for federal data on mobile endpoints.
FEDRAMP-AC-19.evidence: MDM report: /fedramp/ac/ac-19-mdm.pdf shows 42 unregistered devices. Encryption status: 58% encrypted. Policy review: no FedRAMP references.

FEDRAMP-SC-8.title: Transmission Integrity (FedRAMP 2.0)
FEDRAMP-SC-8.description: Transmission integrity controls do not meet FedRAMP expectations. TLS deprecation not enforced; FedRAMP data flows are not integrity protected.
FEDRAMP-SC-8.remediation: Enforce TLS 1.3 for all federal data, sign packets using FedRAMP approved certificates, and deploy end-to-end message authentication codes. Monitor for TLS downgrades and document encryption status in SSP.
FEDRAMP-SC-8.evidence: TLS scan: /fedramp/sc/sc-8-tls.csv shows TLS 1.0/1.1 on 4 service endpoints. Message integrity: not validated. PMO note: 'Transmission integrity out of compliance'.

RMF-CA-2.title: Security Assessments (NIST RMF)
RMF-CA-2.description: System security assessments required by NIST RMF are overdue and incomplete. 3PAO-equivalent validation packages lack evidence of technical control testing.
RMF-CA-2.remediation: Update the RMF security assessment plan, execute vulnerability scanning aligned with NIST SP 800-53, and capture evidence in the authorization package. Remediate findings, update the POA&M, and obtain assessor sign-off before the next step in the RMF cycle.
RMF-CA-2.evidence: RMF assessment log: /rmf/ca-2/assessment-pkg.json indicates missing control families. Assessment package: incomplete. POA&M: 5 items pending for CA-2. Status: RMF Step 5 not reached.

RMF-IR-4.title: Incident Response Testing (NIST RMF)
RMF-IR-4.description: Incident response testing schedule is stale. Tabletop exercises are missing and notification timelines have not been validated for the RMF authorization boundary.
RMF-IR-4.remediation: Conduct RMF-aligned incident response exercises, capture lessons learned, and update the incident response playbook. Ensure notification timelines harmonize with RMF reporting requirements and escalate to authorizing officials when needed.
RMF-IR-4.evidence: IR exercise log: /rmf/ir/ir-4-tests.log last update 11 months ago. Notification drill: not completed. Senior leadership sign-off missing. Incident dossier: incomplete.

RMF-MA-4.title: Nonlocal Maintenance (NIST RMF)
RMF-MA-4.description: Nonlocal maintenance procedures rely on vendor access without dual control. RMF-required break-glass or session monitoring controls are absent.
RMF-MA-4.remediation: Enforce dual control and break-glass for RMF nonlocal maintenance. Log all maintenance sessions, require tamper protection, and document responsibilities in the SSP. Validate configuration management updates post-maintenance.
RMF-MA-4.evidence: Maintenance audit: /rmf/maintenance/ma-4-report.json shows 16 sessions lacking dual supervision. Vendor MFA: weak. Session logging: off. SSP section: incomplete.

RMF-CP-9.title: Information System Backup (NIST RMF)
RMF-CP-9.description: RMF backup requirements are not met. Backups are stored in cleartext and restoration plans have not been exercised for CUI data sets.
RMF-CP-9.remediation: Encrypt backups using FIPS 140-2 validated cryptography, document backup retention aligned with RMF controls, and run quarterly restoration drills. Include results in the RMF contingency plan and share with the authorizing official.
RMF-CP-9.evidence: Backup audit: /rmf/cp/cp-9-backup-report.xlsx shows 100% of backups unencrypted. Drill log: none in 280 days. Retention policy: not approved. Restoration scripts: outdated.

RMF-PL-2.title: System Security Plan (NIST RMF)
RMF-PL-2.description: The SSP lacks RMF references, privacy impact details, and implementation narratives tied to current controls. Authorization milestones are not tracked.
RMF-PL-2.remediation: Update the SSP with RMF control references, include privacy impact statements, and map implementation details to each control. Align the document with RMF authorization milestones and maintain living updates.
RMF-PL-2.evidence: SSP snapshot: /rmf/ssp/ssp-v1.pdf missing RMF control mappings. Privacy section: placeholder text only. Milestone tracker: empty. Control owner table: outdated.

RMF-RA-3.title: Risk Assessment (NIST RMF)
RMF-RA-3.description: Risk assessments are outdated and do not incorporate current threat intelligence. Risk acceptance decisions are stale and unapproved.
RMF-RA-3.remediation: Refresh the risk assessment annually, integrate threat intel from CISA/NCSC, and publish risk acceptance statements. Update the risk register and coordinate with authorizing officials.
RMF-RA-3.evidence: Risk register: /rmf/ra/ra-3-register.xlsx last updated 14 months ago. Threat modeling: missing. Risk acceptance log: unsigned. RMF documentation: outdated.

RMF-SI-4.title: System Monitoring (NIST RMF)
RMF-SI-4.description: RMF ISCM program lacks tuned alerts for high-value assets. Anomaly detection capabilities are not configured for critical controls.
RMF-SI-4.remediation: Define RMF monitoring rules, tune alerts, and enable anomaly detection for privileged activity. Share metrics monthly with authorizing officials and integrate with RMF Step 6 monitoring dashboards.
RMF-SI-4.evidence: Monitoring log: /rmf/si/si-4-tune.csv shows no federal data filtering. Anomaly detection: disabled. Alerts: 2 per week with no response. ISSO notes: insufficient coverage.

RMF-AC-17.title: Remote Access (NIST RMF)
RMF-AC-17.description: Remote administrative access does not meet RMF requirements. Jump hosts not used, MFA lacking, and session monitoring absent.
RMF-AC-17.remediation: Deploy RMF-compliant jump hosts, enforce strong MFA for remote sessions, and log all remote activity. Apply session masking for sensitive operations and review remote access policies quarterly.
RMF-AC-17.evidence: Remote access audit: /rmf/ac/ac-17-jumphost.json shows 12 sessions bypassing jump hosts. MFA: password-only. Logging: disabled. RMF P-ATO review: flagged.

RMF-AC-19.title: Access Control for Mobile Devices (NIST RMF)
RMF-AC-19.description: Mobile device controls are incomplete for handling CUI. BYOD policies unenforced and device management lacks encryption profiling.
RMF-AC-19.remediation: Implement RMF-compliant MDM, enforce encryption on all mobile endpoints, and register devices in the asset inventory. Enable secure containers for federal data and document policies in the SSP.
RMF-AC-19.evidence: MDM report: /rmf/ac/ac-19-mdm.pdf shows 42 unregistered devices. Encryption status: 58% encrypted. Policy review: no RMF references.

RMF-SC-8.title: Transmission Integrity (NIST RMF)
RMF-SC-8.description: Transmission integrity controls fail to enforce modern TLS configurations and integrity checks for RMF systems.
RMF-SC-8.remediation: Enforce TLS 1.3, apply message authentication codes, and monitor for protocol downgrades. Document encryption status in the RMF SSP and include findings in the authorization package.
RMF-SC-8.evidence: TLS scan: /rmf/sc/sc-8-tls.csv shows TLS 1.0/1.1 on 4 endpoints. Message integrity validation missing. PMO note: 'Transmission integrity out of compliance'.

RMF-CA-7.title: Continuous Monitoring (NIST RMF)
RMF-CA-7.description: NIST RMF continuous monitoring strategy not established. ISCM (Information Security Continuous Monitoring) program not implemented. Automated security status monitoring inadequate. Risk scoring methodology not defined per RMF requirements.
RMF-CA-7.remediation: Develop comprehensive ISCM strategy aligned with NIST RMF Step 6 (Monitor). Implement automated continuous monitoring tools for: vulnerability scanning, configuration management, security controls assessment. Define risk scoring methodology using CVSS v3.1. Establish continuous monitoring dashboard with real-time risk visualization.
RMF-CA-7.evidence: RMF assessment: ISCM strategy document not approved. Continuous monitoring: Ad-hoc only. Risk dashboard: Not implemented. Security control monitoring frequency: Undefined. RMF package status: Step 4 complete, Step 6 not started. Documentation: /rmf/ca-7/iscm-strategy-draft.docx.

RMF-PM-9.title: Risk Management Strategy (NIST RMF)
RMF-PM-9.description: Organization-wide risk management strategy not established per NIST RMF. Risk tolerance levels not defined. Risk assessment methodology not documented. Integration with enterprise risk management incomplete.
RMF-PM-9.remediation: Develop organization risk management strategy per NIST SP 800-39. Define risk tolerance levels for confidentiality, integrity, availability. Establish risk assessment methodology using NIST SP 800-30. Implement enterprise risk management integration. Obtain senior leadership approval for risk management strategy.
RMF-PM-9.evidence: RMF documentation review: Risk management strategy not found. Expected location: /rmf/pm-9/risk-strategy.pdf. Risk tolerance: Not defined. Assessment methodology: Inconsistent across systems. ERM integration: 0%. Organizational risk register: Not maintained.

RMF-SA-11.title: Developer Security Testing (NIST RMF)
RMF-SA-11.description: Security testing not integrated into SDLC per RMF requirements. Static application security testing (SAST) not performed. Dynamic application security testing (DAST) coverage inadequate. Software composition analysis not implemented.
RMF-SA-11.remediation: Integrate security testing throughout SDLC aligned with NIST RMF SA family. Implement automated SAST in CI/CD pipeline. Deploy DAST scanning for all web applications. Enable software composition analysis for dependency scanning. Conduct penetration testing per NIST SP 800-115. Document security test results in RMF authorization package.
RMF-SA-11.evidence: SDLC security assessment: SAST tools not deployed. DAST coverage: 12% of applications. SCA implementation: Not started. Penetration test: Last conducted 18 months ago. RMF SA-11 compliance: 23%. Security test repository: /rmf/sa-11/ (mostly empty).

RMF-RA-5.title: Vulnerability Monitoring and Scanning (NIST RMF)
RMF-RA-5.description: Vulnerability scanning does not meet RMF frequency requirements. Authenticated scanning not configured. Vulnerability correlation with threat intelligence not implemented. Remediation tracking inadequate for RMF continuous authorization.
RMF-RA-5.remediation: Implement weekly authenticated vulnerability scanning per NIST RMF requirements. Deploy vulnerability management platform with CVE correlation. Integrate with threat intelligence feeds (CISA KEV, NVD). Establish vulnerability remediation workflow with SLA tracking. Generate monthly vulnerability reports for RMF authorization package updates.
RMF-RA-5.evidence: RMF vulnerability management assessment: Scan frequency: Monthly (RMF requires weekly). Authenticated scans: 45% of assets. Threat intelligence integration: Not configured. CVE tracking: Manual spreadsheet. Remediation metrics: Not automated. Assessment: /rmf/ra-5/vuln-assessment-2026.pdf.

RMF-SC-28.title: Protection of Information at Rest (NIST RMF)
RMF-SC-28.description: Encryption at rest not implemented per NIST RMF cryptographic requirements. FIPS 140-2/140-3 validated modules not used. Cryptographic key management does not meet NIST standards. Data classification not driving encryption requirements.
RMF-SC-28.remediation: Implement FIPS 140-2/140-3 validated encryption for data at rest. Deploy centralized key management system per NIST SP 800-57. Encrypt all CUI (Controlled Unclassified Information) and sensitive data. Document cryptographic implementation in RMF security plan. Conduct annual cryptographic module inventory.
RMF-SC-28.evidence: RMF cryptographic assessment: FIPS validation: 34% of systems. Full-disk encryption: 56% deployment. Database TDE: Not implemented. Key management: Decentralized (non-compliant). CUI encryption: Not enforced. Crypto inventory: /rmf/sc-28/crypto-modules.xlsx (incomplete).
